history.content: OP here. Just heard from the instructors (on summer 61C piazza): they’re not sure why there’s even a waitlist since the class capacity hasn’t been reached (maybe bc people chose full discussion/labs). And everyone on the waitlist will make it in so long as the class capacity isn’t exceeded.

OP here. Just heard from the instructors: they’re not sure why there’s even a waitlist since the class capacity hasn’t been reached (maybe bc people chose full discussion/labs). And everyone on the waitlist will make it in so long as the class capacity isn’t exceeded.

People are wait listed for this class for 1 of 2 reasons:

Either they have a time conflict with a component of the class (lecture or lab)  OR

They chose to enroll into a lab section that has no open seats. Being wait listed at the lab level will also wait list students for the lecture as well.

The remedy in either case is the same - drop the class and re-enroll into another lab that has open seats. Make sure that you have no time conflict with the lecture or lab - if you do, then you will NOT be enrolled but instead will be bumped to the bottom of the wait list.
What are the chances of getting off the waitlist for 61C summer? The lecture shows there being a waitlist, but there are some lab/disc sections without waitlists.
history.subject: 61C summer getting off waitlist
